instruction:
Accounting Math

This section of the test contains multiple-choice questions, which you must answer by using your computer mouse to select the correct response. Upon answering a question, you can go to the next question by clicking the Next button on the Menu bar.

During this section of the test, if you choose you may skip an item and then later return to that item.

When you are finished, select Submit from the Menu bar. Your Test Administrator may have set a time limit for this test section. If there is a time limit, you will be told how much time you have. If a time limit has been set for this section of the test, you will notice a countdown timer on the Header of the screen, showing the amount of time remaining to complete this section of the test.

questions.questionText: A cityâ€™s revenues increased by 20% since the last quarter. If revenues in the previous quarter equaled $40,000, what is the revenue for this quarter?
A Manufacturing company changed the price on its key product line from $7.30 to $8.45. What is this price change equal to?
What is the conversion of the fraction 4/5 into a decimal and percentage?
What can the percentage 40% also be expressed as?
What is the fraction 9/6 converted into a decimal?
What is the fraction 6/5 converted into a percentage?
What fraction can the percentage 66.7% also be expressed as?

Genesis Inc. made the following sales as shown with Price (Quantity): Item A: $4.00 (10) Item B: $5.25 (5) What is the average price of 15 items that were sold? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Hutton Company sold 20 items in January, 40 items in February, and 30 items in March. What is the average number of items sold during the quarter?
Ibarra Corporation bought inventory for resale: 20 items at $5.00 40 items at $5.10 30 items at $5.20 What is the average cost of the inventory items? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
On November 1, 2012 Locked Inc. borrowed $100,000 from the bank at 15% annual interest. What is the interest that Thor Inc. must pay for the two months of November and December?

Fix-It Company collected $16,000 of cash from a customer and promised to provide services over the next four months in exchange. If the end of the accounting period ended after one month, how much should Fix-It Company recognize as revenue after one month?

Use the following 10% present value factors: N = 1: 0.9091 N = 2: 0.8264 N = 3: 0.7513 Assume you wish to receive $1,000 at the end of two years. Assuming an interest rate of 10% what amount would you need to deposit today in order to receive the $1,000? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.

Use the following 10% present value factors: N = 1: 0.9091 N = 2: 0.8264 N = 3: 0.7513 Assume you are to receive $1,000 cash at the end of each year for two years. How much would you need to deposit today in order to receive these two $1,000 payments? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Use the following compound interest table to answer the question. Assuming that interest is paid every six months, what is the 12/31/2011 interest expense?
Use the following compound interest table to answer the question. Assuming that interest is paid every six months, what is the 12/31/2011 Book Value?
You purchase six (6) boxes of paper for $22.37 a box. What is the total? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
What is the total cost for the five (5) tires in the table? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
What is the total number of items being purchased in the table?
What would be the total cost if you purchased only the number of motor oil and vehicle tires listed in the table? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Bill bought 24 books for the library. The total cost was $53.76. What was the average cost for each book? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.

Lois bought four basketballs for a total of $43.13. She returned one of the basketballs for a refund of $11.76. How much did she pay in total for the remaining 3 basketballs? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Matt spent $4.83 for 13 gumdrops, $5.07 for 8 butterscotches, and $7.73 for 21 licorices. What was the average cost for each piece of candy? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Jane works part time and earns $14.31 per hour. How much would Jane earn if she works for 13 and 3/4 hours? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
What is the total cost for 19 cookies if each cookie costs $1.72? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.

A company sells light bulbs for $32.75 a case. There is a 3% discount if payment is made at the time of purchase. How much would the total cost be for 12 cases of light bulbs if payment was made at the time of purchase? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.

John owes $17,000 on a loan. The finance company charges an annual simple interest rate of 8%. If John makes no payments, how much does he own at the end of the three months? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Upon maturity, a man pays $9,000 on the borrowed amount and $1,000 interest. What is the effective interest rate? Round the answer to nearest hundredth if necessary.
What would the total cost of the automotive supplies listed in the table if a 17% discount is given to the total cost? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
What would the total cost of the automotive supplies listed in the table if a 2.73% discount is given to the total cost? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.

The distributer of the items in the table charges a mark up of 7% if you purchase less than 10 vehicle tires. What would be the total cost for the 5 vehicle tires with the mark up added? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
The cost of paper has increased from 52 cents each to 71 cents each. What percent did the cost of paper increase? Round the answer to nearest hundredth if necessary.
The cost of binders has decreased from $3.21 each to $2.77 each. What percent did the cost of each binder decrease? Round the answer to nearest hundredth if necessary.
What percent more is each tire in the table than each motor oil? Round the answer to nearest hundredth if necessary.
Matt owes $4,100.00 on a loan. The finance company charges 2.13% interest each month. How much does Matt owe on the loan at the end of two (2) months? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
Based on the table, what percentage of gross wages from Jack Jones' paycheck is deducted? Round the answer to nearest hundredth if necessary.
Based on the table, what percentage of gross wages is Cindy Mason receiving as net pay? Round the answer to nearest hundredth if necessary.
Based on the table, what would 12.5% of Charles Winfred's gross wages be? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
If Jack Jones was paid each month the amount listed in the table, what is the LEAST number of months before he could pay the full amount for a motorcycle that cost $5,700?

The marketing department of Company XYZ made three purchases during the week of June 1. The first purchase was $35.01, the second purchase was $12.44 and the third purchase was $56.97. What was the total amount of all purchases for the marketing department for the week of June 1? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
The following are all of the transactions recorded for an organization: What is the total of all debits?
The following are all of the transactions recorded for an organization: What is the total of all credits?
The following are all of the transactions recorded for an organization: Assuming a starting balance of $0, what is the ending balance?
The following are all of the transactions recorded for an organization: What is the total of all debits?
The following are all of the transactions recorded for an organization: What is the total of all credits?
The following are all of the transactions recorded for an organization: Assuming a starting balance of $0, what is the ending balance?
A bicycle shop is offering 30% off its entire stock of bicycles. If a bicycle is currently $552.25, how much will it be after the 30% discount? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
If sales tax is 8.89%, how much sales tax would be owed on a $1225.03 purchase? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
$525.00 is what percent of $1500?
On Tuesday The Crab Company sold 71% more than Monday. If the Crab Company sold $2538.03 on Monday, how much did they sell on Tuesday? Round to the nearest penny if necessary.
